forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain and a slight chance of thunderstorms. Cloudy, with a low around 43. North wind 17 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between 1 and 2 inches possible.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.shortForecast: Light Rain Likely then Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely before 8am, then a chance of rain showers. Cloudy, with a high near 56. West wind 7 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
The night in Boston carries a somber weight, cloaked in clouds as rain taps softly against the windows. The air is charged, hinting at the subtle drama of a possible thunderstorm, and the winds, brisk and insistent, weave their way through the empty streets, cooling the dampness just a touch. Dressed in layers, one might find solace in a sturdy jacket, perhaps accompanied by a sturdy umbrella, as the forecast promises a deluge of rain that could accumulate in tight puddles along the sidewalks. 

Tomorrow dawns with its own brand of melancholy, as the rain lingers into the morning, easing into a gentle drizzle throughout the day. The skies will remain overcast, casting a muted light that offers beauty in its restraint. There is comfort to be found indoors—visiting a cozy cafe with a warm beverage in hand or poking around a local bookstore, letting the hours slip by as the world outside remains enshrouded. The day calls for practicality over pomp, urging a reliable pair of shoes suitable for slippery streets and an inner warmth that reflects the soul of this city, ever so vibrant, even when muted.
